intro: Manglietia singalanensis, commonly known as the Singalana manglietia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its large, leathery leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are usually white or pink and bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
